HTML5 standard: Work began in 2003 Working Draft as of 2011
HTML web browser features: N/A
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Work began in 1996 Version 1 released in 1997

HTML web browser features: AmigaOS, MorphOS, Apple macOS, Linux, Microsoft Windows
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Apple macOS, Linux, Microsoft Windows

HTML web browser features: Android 2.3 and newer Apple iOS 6 and newer Symbian Belle BlackBerry OS 7 and 10 Windows Phone 7 and newer
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Android 2.1 to 4.1 Apple iOS (Adobe AIR only) BlackBerry 10 (up to OS 10.3.0) BlackBerry Tablet OS Windows RT

HTML web browser features: PlayStation (PS4, PS3 and PS Vita) Nintendo Switch and Wii U Nintendo 3DS family (partial) Xbox One and Xbox 360
Adobe Flash/AIR features: PlayStation 3 (Flash 9.1) and PSP (Flash 6) Wii (Flash Lite 3.1, equivalent to Flash 8) Leapster (Flash 5 for games) Dreamcast (Flash 4)

HTML web browser features: Full, permission-based access to web camera, microphone, accelerometer and GPS
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Full, permission-based access to web camera, microphone, accelerometer and GPS

HTML web browser features: 82.3% of websites (as of March 28, 2020)
Adobe Flash/AIR features: 4.5% of websites (as of April 19, 2018)

HTML web browser features: 97.5% of browser installations (as of February 2020)
Adobe Flash/AIR features: 29% of browser installations (as of July 2019)

HTML web browser features: Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) supported on ~97% of browsers
Adobe Flash/AIR features: SWF with embedded graphics and AS3SVGRenderer

HTML web browser features: 90+% support of Filters in CSS3 (e.g. Glow, Blur, Drop Shadow, Sepia)
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Yes, applied to text or graphics (e.g. Glow, Drop Shadow, Bevel)

HTML web browser features: Yes
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Yes, with Saffron Type System

HTML web browser features: Installed fonts and custom fonts using CSS 3 web fonts
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Installed fonts and embedded fonts

HTML web browser features: Yes, implemented in most browsers, for system and custom fonts
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Yes, in most cases

HTML web browser features: Only supported inside "pre" tags
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Yes, with Text Layout Framework

HTML web browser features: Yes, via "div" tag and CSS styling
Adobe Flash/AIR features: No, but text fields can be resized in ActionScript

HTML web browser features: Yes, via "table" tag
Adobe Flash/AIR features: No, but text fields can be arranged into a grid

HTML5 standard: As of 2016, two specifications compete: CSS Regions and CSS Overflow
HTML web browser features: With CSS Regions, supported by Safari, IE11 and Edge
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Yes, with Text Layout Framework

HTML web browser features: JavaScript
Adobe Flash/AIR features: ActionScript, Pixel Bender

HTML5 standard: Cross-compiling C++ code to JavaScript via Emscripten
HTML web browser features: Native code execution with Google Native Client in Google Chrome, also supported with WebAssembly (experimental)
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Cross-compiling C++ code to run in Flash Player via FlasCC AIR has AIR Native Extensions that allow loading native code, such as compiled C++ code.

HTML web browser features: Plaintext JavaScript with limited obfuscation, WebAssembly bytecode (experimental), GLSL for GPUs, in Canvas elements
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Compiled bytecode, can be obfuscated

HTML web browser features: CSS 3, HTML, XML, JSON
Adobe Flash/AIR features: JSON, XML, Subset of CSS 1

HTML web browser features: GZIP compression for HTML, JS and CSS files
Adobe Flash/AIR features: LZMA or DEFLATE for SWF files

HTML web browser features: PNG, JPEG, SVG, Animated GIF
Adobe Flash/AIR features: PNG, JPEG, JPEG-XR, Single-frame GIF

HTML web browser features: 90+% support of H.264, varying support of WebM and Ogg Theora (see HTML5 video)
Adobe Flash/AIR features: H.264, Sorenson Spark, and On2 VP6

HTML web browser features: Supported by IE, Edge, Firefox, Chrome, Safari and Opera.
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Flash Video, H.264 and partial support for MP4

HTML web browser features: ~94% support of MP3, AAC and WAV PCM, varying support of Ogg Vorbis, and WebM Vorbis (see HTML5 audio)
Adobe Flash/AIR features: MP3, WAV and AAC audio files or embedded sound

HTML web browser features: Supported on all major desktop browsers, with warning displayed. Not yet widely supported on mobile
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Yes, with warning displayed

HTML web browser features: ~65% support of audio/video files. All other files being plaintext, except for obfuscation
Adobe Flash/AIR features: No, binary formatted files can be decompiled, which is obfuscation

HTML web browser features: ~87% support of single file upload, and drag and drop of files onto browser
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Support for single file upload and generation, AIR only: full create/read/write access to file system

HTML web browser features: ~95% support for canvas element
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Yes, via BitmapData class

HTML web browser features: Yes, via JavaScript Typed Arrays
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Yes, via ByteArray class

HTML web browser features: Via Web Sockets to stream binary or XML data
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Yes, embedded or streaming binary data

HTML web browser features: Yes, via Web storage, HTTP cookie, or Indexed DB to store binary, XML or JSON data
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Yes, via Local Shared Objects to store AMF-formatted data

HTML web browser features: Can be included in meta tags
Adobe Flash/AIR features: Extensible Metadata Platform
